title: Split pane can't dock on secondary monitor
author: JonathonAnderson
body_snippet:
When I try to dock a second pane within the mRemoteNG window while using a second monitor, dragging the pane into a docking area does not activate the area, and I can only create a second window. It works as expected on my primary monitor.

## Expected Behavior
Dragging a second pane should highlight various areas of the screen and dock the second pane when dropped

## Current Behavior
Dragging the pane to different areas does not highlight them
